runs.comm: Starts off in the zone outside off stump and Chris Gayle lets it go through to the 'keeper Rahim who is standing up to the stumps
closer to the off stump, it goes straight on after pitching and Gayle shoulders arms again

Would you believe it? Gayle has gone for a duck! Slightly short in length, just outside the off stump and Gayle cuts it straight to point. Rasel is overjoyed, so are his team-mates as they mob him. Bangladesh are off to a great start.
lands on a length, on the middle and leg, moves towards the leg stump and Chanders is rapped on the pad, trying to turn it to the on side. Rasel rushes forward to pick the ball up.
Signs of some movement off the seam there. It landed on a length, on the off stump line and moved away a touch, Chanderpaul pushes it to the off side. Will we have a maiden over here?
It is a maiden. Full and outside off, nudged to point. Great start by Bangladesh. HRG informs me that this is the eight instance of a team losing a wicket in the first over in a Twenty20 game
full and outside off, dabbed past point
full and outside off, Chanderpaul bends his back knee and attempts a square drive but gets a thick edge through to the third man boundary
on a length, outside off stump, Chanderpaul reaches out and taps it to short third man
we have the first six of the day. Flighted on the off and middle, Chanderpaul leaned forward and swept it high and hard over long leg
fuller, just outside off stump, Chanderpaul moves towards the line and wrists it past square leg.
short in length, a tad quicker, outside off, cut straight to point. There was an opportunity for a four there but he didn't get his placement right. Will Bangladesh persist with this spin attack?
fullish, outside off stump, not much movement this time, Chanderpaul works it into the gap between point and cover for a single
slightly short in length, delivered with a round-armish action, outside off stump, Smith shaped to cut but the ball held up on him and he ended up tapping it to point
fuller, straighter, on the middle and off, Smith seems to have been expecting it to move away but adjusts to stab it to square leg
on a length, outside the off stump, cut to backward point
fuller, around that off stump, Chanderpaul tries to drive through the line but gets an edge down to third man
full and outside off stump, Smith lunges forward, opens the bat-face and steers to third man. Good tight over. Just four runs. Bangladesh will be happy with the start
well outside the off stump and its a wide.
another one. Poor start by Mortaza. West Indies sent down 23 wides the other night. Hope Mortaza is not eyeing that unwanted record
Well ... well ... well  what have we got here. An erratic Mortaza. Another one well outside off stump
Gets it this correct this time. On the off stump line, pushed to point
short and outside the off stump, it help up a touch and so, Smith instead of cutting it square on the off side, goes for a pull shot through wide midwicket
slashed over the slips. Climbs up from a length, around the off stump, Smith flashes at it and it flies over the slip, Rasel comes across from his third man position to make a fine stop
full and in the temptation zone outside off stump, Chanderpaul thinks about playing a drive but withdraws his bat at the last minute
length delivery, angling away from Chanderpaul who is cramped up, going for a cut and the ball rolls towards backward point
in the zone outside off, angling away, Chanderpaul lets Rahim come into play
full in length, outside the off stump, left alone. Rahim is standing up to the stumps
short in length, outside the off stump, Smith mistimes a cut to point.
fuller, closer to the off stump, Smith stays where he is and defends. Rahim loves the delivery, "Oh! yes!," he screams. Rahim is never short of words
a tad short in length, on the middle stump line, Smith tries to pull but mistimes it to square leg. 4 dot balls. The heat is on. Rahim is delighted.
nagging line and length, nipping in off the seam, cramping up Smith who just manages to stab it away
Wonderful over. Just a run off it. On the middle stump line, off a length, pushed towards mid-on
Slapped away. Short and outside off, Smith rocks back to crash it past point.
Another short delivery, another cracking cut but Farhad Reza, at backward point, moves smartly to his left to make a diving stop.
Climbs up from a length, close to the off stump, Smith shapes to cut but is beaten by the extra bounce.
Short again - Mortaza has bowled poorly today, and Smith pulls it easily through midwicket. West Indies are beginning to get a move on, courtesy Smith and Mortaza.
Hmm... another short delivery - Ashraful must be getting an headache - cut fiercely but again Farhad Reza comes in the way.
a tad fuller, on a length, outside off stump, Smith is beaten on the cut shot. Not the length for that shot.
on a length, outside the off stump, Chanderpaul chops it to point. No run. Rasel is strangling the West Indies here.

Nagging line and length is forcing the batsmen to innovate. Chanders walks right across the sticks and tries to lap a length delivery around the corner but makes no contact and the ball thuds into the pad, outside the off stump.
slightly short and width offered outside off stump, cut to deep point
fuller and straighter, on the middle, Smith leans forward, gets his bat around the front pad and turns it to backward square-leg region
lands on a length, moving in towards middle, Smith stays back and works it to deep square leg
climbs up from short of length, outside the off stump, chopped away to third man. Rasel has completed his quota of four overs. Nagging and as a result, economical.
full and outside the off stump, Chanderpaul shapes to cut and is beaten. He would be better off driving that through covbers
Er ... or just walk across and just lap it over deep square leg. Unorthodox but very effective. It was full in length, around that off stump but Chanderpaul played a cheeky little pick-up stroke
fuller, on the off stump, driven to long-off
a tad shorter, on the middle stump line, pulled to deep square leg
full-pitched, outside the off stump, Smith loves to hang on his back foot even if its a fuller delivery, this time knives it through extra cover
brings up the fifty with a fierce pull shot. Slightly short and he was quick to pounce on that.
on the hips, clipped to deep square leg
spins in sharply from outside off, Smith stays back and is surprised at the bounce. It crashed into the rib cage. Good signs if you are a spin bowler
big turn. Landed outside the off stump and spun right across and runs down the leg-side. Wide called. I reckon its a harsh call.
Ah! the straighter one this time and Smith is beaten, playing for spin.
another straighter delivery, outside off, Smith stays back to work it to mid-on
turns from outside off, tapped towards cover and they rush across for a quick single
full-pitched, outside off stump but since this is Twenty20, Chanderpaul reckons he can sweep it , misses it and will pick up a legbye
full and well outside off stump, drilled to sweeper cover
really full and outside off stump, chopped away to left of third man
yorker length, outside off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
Whack. Full-pitched, just outside off stump, Smith drilled it down the track - it almost took out the umpire - to the straight boundary
full again, driven to long-off
on the middle and leg, worked past square leg for a single

Dropped by Aftab Ahmed at deep midwicket. Flighted delivery, on the off stump, slog-swept straight to Aftab who makes a mess of it. Palms facing towards the sky, the ball went in and out. What's more runs over the boundary ropes
spins in from outside off, pushed past cover
short in length, outside the off stump, cut through backward point. He loves that shot. He stays on that back foot and jumps at a half-an-opportunity to cut
spins in, turned to midwicket
short again, outside the off stump and Chanderpaul doesn't let the opportunity go; rocks back to cut it past point. Easy pickings.
fuller, driven to long-off
flatter and quicker, short in length, outside off stump, Smith shapes to pull but is beaten for pace
another cut shot, will get a single.
fullish, on the off stump, driven to long-on
delivered from the front of the hand, fullish and faster, on the middle stump line, turned to square leg
lands on a length, on the middle and off stump line and turns away with bounce, Smith doesn't offer a stroke
fuller and driven to left of long-on
turn and bounce. Smith shapes to cut but pulls out at the last minute
leans forward to work a full delivery to midwicket
low dipping full toss, on the middle, turned to deep midwicket
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
from wide of the crease, spins in quickly from outside off stump, Smith tries to tickle to the on side, misses and it thuds into the pad
and again. Good stuff from Razzak
fuller, on the middle and off, driven through mid-on
Gone! The pressure to up the run-rate does him in. Flighted, too full and Chanderpaul shaped to slog-sweep but the full length meant he could only send it towards long-on.

huge shout for lbw. Close. Full and on the off and middle, Samuels is rooted to the crease and pushes at it. The arm-ball, from round the stumps, evades the prod and strikes him in front of off stump. That would have hit the stumps. The umpire must have felt the point of impact was outside off
gets off the mark with a drive to long-on
yorker length, on the middle and leg, squeezed out to long-on. Samuels looks to be in pain. Trouble for West Indies.
leans forward to drive to long-off
drifts in on to the middle, full and straight, driven to long-on
flighted, full and on the off stump, slog-swept towards deep midwicket.
low full toss, driven to right of long-on. The runs are coming in just ones and twos. They need a few big overs. Bangladesh are doing well with the squeeze act
lands on a length, on the middle, spins down the leg side, Smith tries a slog sweep but misses and is struck outside the line of leg stump
slightly short in length, turns away from off stump, cut to deep point.
gets his man with a quicker one. Clever. He saw Smith charging down the track and sent down a quicker one, full as well and it yorked Smith. Clean bowled.
drifting on to the legs, turned to short fine leg
spinning away from the off stump, cut past point
quick, flat, full and on the legs, turned past short fine leg
That's a biggie! He cleared the front foot, opened up his stance and slogged it over cow corner. That went out of the ground
Brutal hit straight down the ground. The charge is on. Samuels is hitting out.
Samuels goes down town. Full and on the middle stump line, again he cleared the front foot and launched it right over the bowler's head. Stunning.
The run-orgy continues. Full and on the off stump line, Samuels leans forward to drive it inside-out over cover
beaten outside off stump. Full and outside off, he tries to drive but can't connect
Samuels is gone. Full and on the off stump line, he drives straight to cover. Samuels had looted 20 runs in the over before succumbing.
comes down the track, reaches the pitch and drives to right of long-on
fires it in, Sarwan backs away a touch to get adjacent to the line and drives inside-out to deep cover
full and just outside off stump, Ramdin tries to cut and is beaten
drifts in from round the stumps, driven uppishly over the umpire's head

Another one goes down. Loopy delivery on the middle stump line, Ramdin opens up his stance and attempts a slog-sweep but ends up skying it straight up in the air and Rahim has all the time in the world to get under it
peach of a delivery. It landed on a length, on the middle stump line and spun sharply past the outside edge.
full and well outside off stump, Dwayne drills it to long-on
just a single. A push to midwicket
Dwayne gets into the act. He loves hitting sixes and he slog-sweeps a fullish delivery over wide long-on
Dwayne goes straight this time. Full, on the middle, he clears the front foot and scythes it straight over the bowler's head. Up up and over
Brutal slog sweep. Three in a row. Smith is having a wild party out there. Full and on the middle line, he went down on his knee to slog-sweep it high over wide long-on.
Full again, swiped to deep midwicket region. The run-orgy continues. What a finish by West Indies
Stumped! He runs down the track, the bowler drags back the length and Sarwan tries to work it to on side but is then, beaten by the turn. Rahim does the rest.
leans forward to drive past cover. Four balls to go.
Stumped again! Shakib is using those little grey cells. He sees Bravo come down the track, drags back the length and gets it to turn past the intended poke. Quite similar to the Sarwan dismissal.
Nagging over continues. Arm-ball, on the off and middle, turned to the off side for a single
Violent hit over cow corner. Full and around the off and middle stump line, Smith carves it to the left of the deep midwicket region
Three wickets in the last over. Slightly slower this time and that beats the intended slog sweep.
